cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 175 mi south of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move north across the Yucatan Channel, strengthen in the Gulf of Mexico, then accelerate NE toward the Florida Panhandle and the southeastern United States, eventually emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast late Day-4/Day-5
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City–Apalachicola area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Cabo Catoche, Mexico (Yucatan Peninsula)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio and Isle of Youth
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Yucatan Channel, Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Florida, inland Southeast U.S., Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Only occasional gusts below gale force expected when the weakening system passes offshore; operational winds likely remain <25 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge anticipated at New York Harbor because the system will be a weakened inland remnant and passing well south of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain showers (generally <2 in.) possible late 11–12 Oct as the remnant low passes offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor visibility restrictions in rain; otherwise none significant for port operations.
